Daly_City.Roxie Theater:
The Roxie Theater, also known as the Roxie Cinema or just The Roxie, is a movie theater at 3117 16th Street in the Mission District of San Francisco built in 1909. It is a non-profit corporation.


== History ==
The oldest continuously operating movie theater in the US, the Roxie opened its doors as the C. H. Brown Theater in 1909, and was owned and operated as the Poppy Theater from 1912 to 1916 by Philip H. Doll, a local jeweler and watchmaker.
